references.paper_title: SWE-Bench: Can language models resolve real-world GitHub issues?
references.reason: This paper introduces SWE-Bench, the benchmark dataset upon which the current paper's benchmark, SWT-Bench, is based.

references.paper_title: SWE-Agent: Agent Computer Interfaces Enable Software Engineering Language Models
references.reason: This paper introduces SWE-Agent, one of the code agents evaluated in the current paper, highlighting its relevance to code-based test generation.

references.paper_title: Large language models are few-shot testers: Exploring LLM-based general bug reproduction
references.reason: This paper introduces LIBRO, a state-of-the-art LLM-based test generation method that is compared against in the current paper, showing its significance in the field.

references.paper_title: Automated unit test improvement using large language models at Meta
references.reason: This paper is a key reference on LLM-based automated unit test generation which is the central focus of the current paper, showing its importance as a related work.

references.paper_title: Repairagent: An autonomous, LLM-based agent for program repair
references.reason: This paper is another relevant work on LLM-based code agents, showcasing its contribution to the field of code repair and highlighting its relevance to the current paper's exploration of code agents for test generation.
